articles.title: NRC Denounces Park Geun Hye for Escalating Confrontation against DPRK
articles.content:
NRC Denounces Park Geun Hye for Escalating Confrontation against DPRK
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the National Reconciliation Council (NRC) issued a statement on Friday denouncing the confrontation moves of Park Geun Hye.
					With the approach of the "National Assembly" election in south Korea, Park Geun Hye of the "Saenuri Party" is more undisguisedly revealing her true colors standing for confrontation against reunification, the statement said.
					
					It went on:
					
					Decrying the DPRK's planned launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 as a long-range missile test, Park let loose a spate of sophism that the launch would be a "challenge to the world peace" and the "international pressure should be put on it." She went the lengths of slandering the dignity of the DPRK, while begging someone to "stop deportation of human scum to the north".
					
					She even tries to defend and put forward human scum in the puppet political arena.
					
					Meanwhile, she has kicked up coloring offensive against the DPRK, asserting that no one can vouch for anything that may happen if those who deny the "north's" involvement in the "Cheonan" warship sinking incident are allowed to be members of the "National Assembly". She even rejected investing the opposition camp with the "power", the camp that has opposed south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement" and the Jeju naval base construction. She also said that those "left-wing forces siding with the north" should not be allowed to seize power.
					
					The conspiratorial racket of confrontation against the compatriots Park Geun Hye has kicked up in collusion with traitor Lee Myung Bak revealed that "change" and "reform" touted by her were no more than absurd artifice to divert elsewhere the public mindset and opinion and that she is a confrontation maniac little different from traitor Lee Myung Bak.
					
					This proves that Park Geun Hye is a disgusting political prostitute as she used to join hands with the conservative regime and ruling party when the situation turned favorable but coldheartedly turned her back if she found it unfavorable even a bit.
					
					The fact clearly shows that Park Geun Hye is indeed a political swindler and brazen-faced power-seeker who stoops to any infamy to gratify her political ambition.
					
					It is clear that the north-south relations would never be pulled out of deadlock if such venomous element seizes power as she is keen on reviving the departed soul of erstwhile "yusin" dictatorship in south Korea.
					
					The statement called on various circles of south Korea to punish the puppet conservative group of traitors in the election, not being deceived by Park Geun Hye and her group.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Accused of Violating Spirit of Red Cross
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Accused of Violating Spirit of Red Cross
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society on Friday released a detailed report disclosing before the world the crimes the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea has committed by derailing the humanitarian undertakings between the north and the south in violation of the spirit of the Red Cross.
					The report said:
					
					No sooner had traitor Lee Myung Bak come to power than he bar the north-south Red Cross humanitarian undertakings which had become brisk since the publication of the Juche 15 joint declaration.
					
					The south Korean regime let the "Ministry of Unification" put the humanitarian work between the north and the south under its control, making the south Korean Red Cross an entity that exists in name only. It appointed vicious confrontation elements to the posts of minister of Unification and president of the south Korean Red Cross, reducing it to a waiting maid of the authorities.
					
					In March of 2010 the regime fabricated "the Cheonan" warship case, rendering the situation extremely tense. It announced "May 24 Step," totally scuttling the humanitarian cooperation between the north and the south.
					
					Its total denial and violation of the north-south declarations and inter-Korean agreements based on them derailed the humanitarian cooperation undertakings which had made brisk headway.
					
					Its actions brought the reunion of separated families and relatives, the most urgent of the inter-Korean humanitarian cooperation undertakings, to a total suspension. 
					
					The Lee group blocked in a high-handed manner the reunion of separated families and relatives which had taken place at Mt. Kumgang resort several times every year since the announcement of June 15 joint declaration.
					
					It also put an end to video reunion of separated families and relatives between the north and the south and their exchange of letters on screen.
					
					Last year alone, more than 4 000 south Korean applicants for reunions in south Korea died, cursing the group of traitors, without having their ardent desire to reunite with their families and relatives in the north realized. 
					
					The group lured and kidnapped inhabitants of the DPRK and kicked up an anti-DPRK conspiratorial racket, adding to the separated families and relatives.
					
					It blocked the above-said cooperation undertakings under the pretexts of diversion to a military purpose and transparency. It also made an overall retrogressive revision of the "law on exchange and cooperation between the north and the south," tightening the legal control over those undertakings so that even a single gram of materials might not go to the north without the permission of the "Ministry of Unification."
					
					It went the lengths of despicably and viciously disturbing the humanitarian cooperation undertakings related to natural disasters.
					
					Traitor Lee declared it as an important policy to pull up the north over its non-existent human rights issue, blustering "south Korea will say what it should do about the human rights issue of the north." 
					
					He appointed an ultra-right conservative element ignorant of elementary conception of human rights as chief of the human right committee, reducing it to a "government"-sponsored institution specializing in kicking up human rights racket against the DPRK.
					
					Despite repeated warnings of the DPRK, the puppet group hurled all hues of riff-raffs and anti-DPRK hysteric elements into such campaigns as scattering leaflets slandering it and worthless things by use of balloons into its areas.
					
					It went the lengths of staging an anti-DPRK human rights racket even in the international arena in a bid to defame the dignity and system of the DPRK.
					
					The high treason the group committed when the nation suffered the biggest loss in December last year and the hideous provocations it perpetrated by hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK were the height of its inhumane and unethical acts to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK. These barbaric acts can be committed only by hordes of immoral elements like the Lee group of traitors.
					
					It is something beyond imagination to discuss humanitarianism with such cold-hearted elements and gangsters without equals in the world as the Lee group.

articles.title: Kim Yong Chun Meets Chinese Army Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Chun Meets Chinese Army Delegation
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Vice-Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Yong Chun, minister of the People's Armed Forces, Friday had a friendly talk with the visiting delegation of diplomatic officials of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Major General Qian Lihua, director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Ministry of National Defense.

articles.title: Ghanaian President Hopes for Developing Friendly Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Ghanaian President Hopes for Developing Friendly Relations with DPRK
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Ghanaian government values the friendly relations with the DPRK.
					Ghanaian President John Evans Atta Mills said this on March 30 when he received credentials from DPRK Ambassador to his country Jong Hak Se.
					
					He said he was pleased with the two countries developing excellent relationship of friendship since the establishment of diplomatic ties. He hoped that the bilateral relations would grow stronger in various fields.

articles.title: Greetings to Arab Baath Socialist Party
articles.content:
Greetings to Arab Baath Socialist Party
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a message of greeting to the National Leadership of the Arab Baath Socialist Party (ABSP) on Friday on the occasion of its 65th anniversary.
					The message expressed great pleasure over the achievements made by the party for 65 years since its foundation in the efforts to strengthen it and ensure the country's independent progress under the correct leadership of Hafez al－Assad, the Syrian people's eternal leader, and President Bashar Al－Assad, who is the party's regional secretary.
					
					The message extended full support to the efforts of ABSP and the people to thwart plots of enemies and ensure the country's sovereignty and stability, expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between WPK and ABSP will further develop in the future.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statue of Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and the family of Jong Il Sim, a compatriot in Russia, and their parties Friday laid bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Ryongnam Hill and paid tribute to him.
					They arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chinese Delegation
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from the visiting delegation of diplomatic officials of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.
					The gift was handed to Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Yong Chun, minister of the People's Armed Forces, Friday by Major General Qian Lihua, director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Ministry of National Defense, who is heading the delegation.

articles.title: IIJI Director-General Here
articles.content:
IIJI Director-General Here
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea who is secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council, arrived here Friday to take part in the World Congress on the Juche Idea.
					Arriving here on the same day were a delegation of the Far Eastern Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Policy of Russia led by its Chairman Anatoli Dolgachev, A. I. Donchenko, chief of the Blagobeshensk, Russia, Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Idea, and a delegation of the Russian Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, History and Culture of the DPRK led by its Chief Anatoli Kulkov.

articles.title: International Marathon to Be Held
articles.content:
International Marathon to Be Held
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The IAAF-25th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon will take place in Pyongyang on Sunday.
					It will draw men and women marathoners from the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, China, Russia, Ukraine, Kenya, Ethiopia, Tanzania, Zimbabwe, Sweden, Namibia, South Africa and Taipei of China.
					
					They will take four rounds of a little more than 10 kilometers course, covering the Arch of Triumph, Ryonghung Crossroad, Kumrung Tunnel No.2, Chongryu Bridge, Rungna Bridge, Kumrung Tunnel and the Moranbong Circus Theatre, starting from Kim Il Sung Stadium.
					
					The total distance is 42.195 kilometers.
					
					Players who prove successful in the tournament will be qualified for the 30th Olympic Games.
					
					The tournament will contribute to significantly commemorating President Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Prize Awarded to Design for Huichon Power Station
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Prize Awarded to Design for Huichon Power Station
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Sung Prize was awarded to the design for Huichon Power Station in the DPRK.
					The design greatly contributed to creditably carrying out the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il by successfully building the station as a monumental structure of eternal value to fully demonstrate the heroic stamina of Songun Korea and its tremendous national power under a grandiose plan of the Workers' Party of Korea for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					A relevant decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly was promulgated on April 1.

articles.title: DPRK Commends Builders of Huichon Power Station
articles.content:
DPRK Commends Builders of Huichon Power Station
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The DPRK officially commended 57 872 services personnel, builders, officials and designers who made big contributions to completing the Huichon Power Station in the run up to the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on it was released on April 1. 
					
					According to it, title of Labor Hero went to 100, Order of Kim Il Sung to five, Kim Il Sung Prize to two and Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize to 91.
					
					Five were awarded the title of Designer of Merit, six the title of Builder of Merit, 21 the title of Driver of Merit, three the title of Electricity worker of Merit, 791 the First Class of the Order of National Flag, 950 Order of Labor, 15 288 the Second Class of the Order of National Flag, 1 243 the First Class of the Order of Soldier's Honor, 21 107 the Third Class of the Order of National Flag, 4 447 the Second Class of the Order of Soldier's Honor, 10 146 Distinguished Military Service Medal and 3 667 Medal of Merit.

articles.title: Commemoration Medal Awarded to Builders of Huichon Power Station
articles.content:
Commemoration Medal Awarded to Builders of Huichon Power Station
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Commemoration medal was conferred on the builders of the Huichon Power Station, 78 339 in all, in the DPRK.
					A relevant decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly was announced on April 1.

articles.title: Huichon Power Station Goes Operational
articles.content:
Huichon Power Station Goes Operational
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The construction of the Huichon Power Station has been completed in the DPRK.
					The completion makes it possible to more satisfactorily settle the shortage of electricity in Pyongyang, protect cultivated land and residential areas along the River Chongchon from flood and ensure an ample supply of industrial water to the industrial establishments in Huichon and Namhung areas.
					
					The builders finished the construction of the power station in a matter of three years though it would have taken more than a decade at normal pace.
					
					Inaugural ceremonies were held at Huichon Power Station Nos. 1 and 2 on Thursday.
					
					Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Kim Yong Chun, Choe Thae Bok, Thae Jong Su and others.
					
					A joint congratulatory message sent by the Central Committee and Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea to the soldier-builders, members of the shock brigades, officials and helpers who distinguished themselves in the construction of the power station was conveyed there.
					
					The message said that the builders, who devotedly carried out the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and demonstrated before the whole world that Korea does what it is determined to do, are true descendants of the President, soldiers and disciples faithful to Kim Jong Il and heroes of the times and patriots to be respected by the whole country.
					
					The Party will always remember the heroic feats performed by the builders who erected a gigantic structure for the country's prosperity and its people's happiness, it noted.
					
					It highly praised them for successfully building a giant power base in Huichon in a short span of time and thereby making a great contribution to settling the shortage of electricity in the country and instilling conviction of sure victory and hope into all people.
					
					Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and premier of the Cabinet, made addresses at the ceremonies.
					
					He said that the Huichon Power Station is a monumental structure built in the Songun era thanks to the wise leadership provided by Kim Jong Il to build a thriving socialist nation on this land.
					
					Referring to the achievements made in the construction, Choe noted these are the brilliant fruition of the wise guidance and meticulous care of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un who unrolled a grandiose plan for the building of the power station and energetically led the drive for its completion.
					
					Speeches were made there.
					
					The participants looked round Power Station Nos. 1 and 2.

articles.title: Book "Comrade Kim Il Sung, Peerlessly Great Man" Vol. 5 Published
articles.content:
Book "Comrade Kim Il Sung, Peerlessly Great Man" Vol. 5 Published
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 5 "The Great Man" of five volume book "Comrade Kim Il Sung, Peerlessly Great Man" to mark the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung. 
					This volume systematically deals with detailed facts about the personality of the President as a peerlessly great man. It has four chapters.
					
					Chapter 1 "Great Man Standing on Top of Human Intelligence" deeply explains the noble intellectual world of the President. 
					
					Chapter 2 "Supreme Incarnation of Human Love" tells about the greatness of the President, who dedicated all his life to profound love for the people. 
					
					Chapter 3 "Strongest Man with Indomitable Mental Power" impressively tells about the greatness of the President, who pulled through all difficulties with iron-faith, will, courage and guts. 
					
					Chapter 4 "Ordinary but Great Man with Noble Personality" deals with vivid facts about the traits of the President, who lived the humblest and simplest life.

articles.title: Commemorative Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
Commemorative Stamps Issued in DPRK
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau has recently issued stamps (a sheetlet, a sheet and an individual stamp) in commemoration of the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					Seen in the upper parts of the stamps are letters "On 100th Birth Anniversary of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung", "Juche 1 (1912)-Juche 101 (2012)", "April 15" and "Day of the Sun".
					
					Printed on the sheetlet carrying a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung are art pieces showing the President and Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, among children of revolutionary school and the President among people.
					
					The sheet contains images of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Suk standing in front of the President's old home in Mangyongdae with smile on their faces in a spring day.
					
					Seen in individual stamp are the President's old home in Mangyongdae and letters "100th Anniversary" against the background of Kimilsungia and magnolia, national flower of the DPRK. 
					
					The commemorative stamps stress that Kim Il Sung was tender-hearted father and the eternal sun of Juche as he devoted all his life to the happiness of the people and laid solid foundations for the building of a thriving nation.
					
					The third part of serial commemorative stamps (three sheetlets, a sheet and seven individual stamps) representing the revolutionary exploits of the President were produced on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, his birth anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lays Foundation for National Unity
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lays Foundation for National Unity
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung performed great feats in providing a foundation of all-nation unity in order to reunify Korea in an independent and peaceful way. 
					In April Juche 82 (1993), he published a celebrated work "10-point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country", which elucidates the aim, ideological basis, principle and methods for national unity.
					
					The President saw the great unity of the whole nation as a key to overpowering the anti-reunification moves of the separatist forces and giving momentum to the movement for independent reunification. 
					
					One day, he told an official by phone that the 10-point programme was based on the Ten-point Programme of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland calling on those with strength to give strength, those with knowledge to dedicate knowledge and those with money to donate money in order to put an end to the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule over Korea through the concerted efforts of all the Korean people. 
					
					He then suggested making public the 10-point programme at the Fifth Session of the Ninth Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK scheduled for April 7, 1993.  
					
					Soon after it was released, all the Korean people at home and abroad praised the 10-point programme as the banner of reconciliation and unity and a blueprint for national reunification. 
					
					The programme serves as one of the three charters for national reunification, along with the Three Principles of National Reunification and the Proposal for Founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered by Workers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered by Workers
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held by workers and members of trade unions before the old home of President Kim Il Sung in Mangyongdae on Friday in the run-up to the centenary of his birth.  
					The meeting was themed "The great leader is our eternal father." Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, spoke at the meeting. 
					
					With the centenary of the birth of the President approaching, all the workers and trade union members feel irrepressible yearning for him, Hyon said.
					
					He referred to the immortal exploits of the President, who formed a mass organization of the working class and indicated the road for the trade union to follow in every period of the developing revolution and at its each stage.
					
					He stressed that the President is the benevolent father of the people and the sun of the nation as he put forward the Korean workers as masters of the revolution and eldest sons of the country and made them enjoy a worthy life.
					
					Officials and workers of various units associated with the leadership exploits of the President and Kim Jong Il took the floor to speak of their revolutionary careers.
					
					They sang "May of Victory", "Our Unforgettable Leader", etc.

articles.title: Ten-day Film Show Begins in DPRK to Mark Day of Sun
articles.content:
Ten-day Film Show Begins in DPRK to Mark Day of Sun
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- A ten-day film show began in the DPRK to commemorate the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun.
					To be screened at cinemas and cultural centers in Pyongyang and other parts of the country during the period will be documentary films on revolutionary histories of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. They will include "President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il Were Always Together on the Road for the Well-Being of the People", "Led By Great Brilliant Commander" and "Care Shown to Make Their Lives Shine".
					
					Feature films will include "Star of Korea", "The Sun of the Nation", "My Country", "Longing for the Sunshine", "Mt. Paektu" and "A Photograph".
					
					An opening ceremony was held at the People's Palace of Culture on Friday.
					
					Attending it were Kim Ki Nam and other officials concerned.
					
					Minister of Culture An Tong Chun made an opening address.
					
					Similar events took place at all provinces on the same day.

articles.title: National Oratorical Meeting Commemorates Day of Sun
articles.content:
National Oratorical Meeting Commemorates Day of Sun
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- A national oratorical meeting took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Friday in commemoration of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					The speakers told in excited tones about the great fortune of the army and people of the DPRK who are blessed with the peerlessly great leaders generation after generation while always holding in high esteem them who performed undying feats for the era, the revolution, the country and the people.
					
					In an oratory titled "Blessed with the sun", Ryang Chun Sik, worker at the Tongdaewon Unha Garment Factory, said how much the Korean people are blessed with great leaders.
					
					Ri Ok Sil in Anhwa-dong in Rason City, in her oratory "Great man and song", noted that the Unhasu concert arranged by the dear respected Kim Jong Un on the International Women's Day demonstrated the tradition of the Korean revolution wining victory advancing with song and firm spirit of the country with song.
					
					In oratories "Eternal Whistle" and "Love Flows", Nam Chun Bin, chairman of the primary committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea of Pyongyang Railway Station, and An Thae Hwa, lecturer of the Central Information and Communications Centre Committee of the Federation, said:
					
					The President and leader Kim Jong Il were, indeed, the supreme incarnation of largesse as they lavished the people with all sorts of loving care and benevolence.
					
					Kim Yong Hui, official of Pyongyang Vaccine Factory, and Kim Kwang Guk, student of Wonsan Jo Kun Sil University of Technology, in oratories "Family of Mangyongdae blessed with much work" and "The history of comradeship" told emotional stories about the noble personalities of the great persons of Mt. Paektu. 
					
					Attending the meeting were Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok and officials of ministries, national institutions and those in the city of Pyongyang.

articles.title: National Sports Festival for Mangyongdae Prize Opens
articles.content:
National Sports Festival for Mangyongdae Prize Opens
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- A national sports festival for Mangyongdae Prize was opened with due ceremony at Kim Il Sung Stadium Friday to commemorate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					During the festival its participants will compete in some 40 events including soccer, basketball, volleyball, softball, weightlifting, judo, gymnastics, track-and-field, swimming, archery and figure skating.   They will take place in Pyongyang, Phyongsong, Wonsan, Nampho, Samjiyon and other areas.
					
					Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, in his opening address called on all sportspersons and coaches to glorify the revolutionary career and exploits of great persons of Mt. Paektu and prove successful in physical culture and sports this year. He then declared the festival open.
					
					The speakers called upon the sportspersons and coaches to brush up Korean-style sports techniques through ideological, fighting spirit, speed and technical campaigns and thus demonstrate before the whole world the dignity and honor of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea with gold medals.
					
					There was a demonstration performance of parachutists of the Pyongyang Aviation Club and men's football match between the Sobaeksu Sports Group and the sports group of the Ministry of Light Industry.

articles.title: National Taekwon-do Festival Opens
articles.content:
National Taekwon-do Festival Opens
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- A national Taekwon-do festival opened with due ceremony at the Taekwon-Do Hall on Friday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun.
					Ace Taekwon-doists from across the country will compete in various events such as men's and women's individual pattern and sparring matches.
					
					An opening address was made by Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee.
					
					Then Taekwon-do demonstrations were given by instructors and players. 
					
					Meanwhile, paduk (go) and Korean wrestling events of the above-said festival took place in Wonsan and Sariwon from March 28 to April 6.
					
					Men players of the Pyongyang City Taekwon-Do Team and women players of Korea University of Physical Education came first in the group of paduk players, boy players of Pyongyang and girl players of North Hamgyong Province in the group of kindergarteners and Kangwon Province in the group of elders.
					
					Pyongyang won the title of Korean wrestling event in Sariwon.

articles.title: Food Festival Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Food Festival Held in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The 17th April Holiday Food Festival was held at the People's Palace of Culture from April 4 to 6.
					The festival brought together 49 units selected from ministries and national institutions and provinces. It involved a contest in technical skill and demonstrations of cooks and waiters and waitresses, shows of local special dishes and famous dishes presented by catering units, an exhibition of achievements made in cooking science and technology, public presentation of experience, etc.
					
					Presented to the festival were more than 1 300 national food and various kinds of dishes and over 400 pieces of scientific and technological successes.
					
					Appreciated at the festival were popular food presented by restaurants under the General Bureau of Public Service including Okryu Restaurant, Chongryu Restaurant, Changgwang Restaurant Management Office and Chilsong Restaurant, catering units under the Kyonghung and Rakwon Guidance Bureaus and Taedonggang and Moranbong district restaurants management offices. 
					
					Drawing attention of experts and participants were varieties of food prepared with local specialties in South Hamgyong, North Phyongan and Jagang provinces and Rason City. 
					
					Also on display there were sturgeon, soft-shelled turtle, bullfrog and other famous dishes.
					
					Conspicuous in the festival were a contest of cooks in the skills of cooking dishes before participants and waiters and waitresses' demonstrations of their refined skills and a high level of their service. 
					
					A closing ceremony took place on Friday.

articles.title: Young People Meet to Remember Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Young People Meet to Remember Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting of school youth and children themed "The dear Generalissimo Kim Il Sung is our eternal sun" took place before his statue at Changdok School in Pyongyang on Friday as part of festivities timed for the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					The participants laid floral baskets, bouquets and flowers before the statue before making a bow in humble reverence.
					
					The meeting began with poem and chorus "Generalissimo Is Our Sun". The performers recalled the past days when Kim Il Sung made great devotions to the younger generation regarding its education as a key issue on which the country's future hinges.
					
					Principal of the school Kang Jun Ho told the touching story that Kim Il Sung made sure that good educational conditions were provided for children after the country's liberation and pencil issue was discussed as the first agenda of the Provisional People's Committee of North Korea.
					
					Speakers included Ri Myong Sun, and Ri Kyong Dae, official of Kim Chaek University of Technology, who had the honor of being received and blessed by Kim Il Sung in the early days of their lives. Calling back on those days they praised the President for his noble trait.
					
					Kim Kwang Suk, coach of the Pyongyang Sports Team, and Han Song Il, teacher of Pyongyang University of Fine Arts, said the President let the sprouts of talents of children blossom. They recalled how the President put them forward, sharing pleasure with them when they won medals in international matches.
					
					Jon Hye Yong, teacher of the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, said how she pleased him with her good songs. The audience was convinced that thanks to the warm sunrays all children across the country blossom, displaying their talents.
					
					With the sentiment of thanks and admiration for Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il pervading the meeting hall, songs "We Are the Happiest in the World" and "Our Father" reverberated.

articles.title: Branch Schools on Islets in West Sea of Korea
articles.content:
Branch Schools on Islets in West Sea of Korea
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has branch schools on islets in the West Sea of Korea, each for a few children.
					Typical of them are schools on Suun and Rap islets in waters off North Phyongan Province.
					
					Light-keepers and their children are residing in the islets far away from Sinuiju City.
					
					The government of the DPRK built branch schools for one pupil on Suun Islet and two pupils on Rap Islet.
					
					Those primary schools are equipped with teaching tools, visual aids, samples of animals and plants and other teaching instruments. School opening and graduation ceremonies take place there like other schools on land.
					
					Foreign crews, who dropped in at the islets for some reasons, were moved to see the branch schools. 
					
					They said it is only the DPRK that has public schools for a few children and that they should be listed on Guinness Book of World Records for their smallest enrollment in the world.

articles.title: Cold Weather Affects Farming in DPRK
articles.content:
Cold Weather Affects Farming in DPRK
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Untimely snowfall swept most parts of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea some days ago, accompanied by stormy wind, causing temperature lower than the average.
					In this regard, KCNA met Kim Yang Il, a section chief of the Academy of Agricultural Science.
					
					He said:
					
					What was affected most severely is wheat and barley sown as early crops.
					
					The low temperature will diminish the regeneration rate of those crops and delay the days of their regeneration, making it hard to harvest them.
					
					It also gives adverse effect on sprouting of rice seeds sowed in late March.
					
					The temperature in blanketed seedbeds should run between 28 and 30 degrees C. And, great changes of temperatures in days and nights are making the sowed seeds rotten.
					
					In the meantime, the low temperature hinders the growth of potato plants. 
					
					In a word, if this weather continues, it will badly affect the overall farming throughout the country this year.

articles.title: "Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (21)
articles.content:
"Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (21)
Kim Il Sung Presses Ahead with Modeling Whole Society on Juche Idea
					
					Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung had paid big efforts to modeling the whole society on the Juche idea, thus turning the DPRK into a politically and ideologically strong socialist state in the 1980s.
					
					At the 6th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea held in October Juche 69 (1980), he declared the modeling of the whole society on the Juche idea a general task for the Korean revolution.
					
					Modeling the whole of society after the Juche idea means realizing the complete independence of the working masses by remoulding all members of society into communists of a Juche-type and transforming all aspects of social life in accordance with the Juche idea. 
					
					To this end, Kim Il Sung underscored the need to firmly maintain independent and creative stand and implement the line of three revolutions -- ideological, technical and cultural.
					
					He also worked hard to transform all social members on a revolutionary, working-class and intellectual pattern and put the national economy on a Juche-oriented, modern and scientific basis. 
					
					Meanwhile, he conducted energetic activities to develop the WPK into a Juche-oriented revolutionary party.
					
					He paid close attention to establishing the party's monolithic ideological system, consolidating the ideological unity between the party and the revolutionary ranks with leader Kim Jong Il as the centre, and defending and carrying forward the party's revolutionary tradition.
					
					In the mid-1980s when ruling parties in some socialist countries were beginning to take a wrong road, he published a famous work "Historical Experience of Building the Workers' Party of Korea" to introduce the experiences gained in party building and activities.
					
					In April 1982, he set modeling the whole army on the Juche idea as a general task for beefing up the army and wisely led the efforts to strengthen the Korean People's Army in political and ideological and military technological aspects. 
					
					Considering that the army's might rests with politico-ideological advantage, not with equipment, he saw to it that the party's monolithic ideological system was established in the KPA.
					
					In particular, he energetically pushed ahead with ensuring Kim Jong Il's commanding system throughout the army.
					
					As a result, all social fields were transformed to meet the requirements of the Juche idea, which made it possible for the DPRK to continue advancing along the road of socialism, not affected by any external situation.

articles.title: Japan Has No Future: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Japan Has No Future: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries have pursued their wild ambition to grab Tok Islets generation after generation.
					At the instruction of the government, the number of the textbooks in which Tok Islets are described as "part of Japan's territory" increased out of 39 kinds of social science textbooks of senior high schools in Japan including history and geography. It reached 21.
					
					Even the chief cabinet secretary of Japan let loose outbursts that Japan would react to the protest against the controversial textbooks on the basis of its consistent stand, blustering that it is unacceptable.
					
					In the past it was only ultra-right elements that raised a claim to Tok Islets but now it has become an open policy to claim this in the whole field of education at the prodding of the government.
					
					Its brigandish claim and education are lashing all Koreans into great fury, going beyond their concern and vigilance as they are premised on a war to stage a comeback to Korea.
					
					Tok Islets have always been part of the inviolable territory of the Korean nation and there exists no "territorial dispute."
					
					Nevertheless, the Japanese reactionaries make "dispute" over the islets an established fact, insisting the territory of other country belongs to Japan, and are putting spurs to mental education of the youngsters for the purpose of launching a war for reinvasion of Korea to seize the islets one day.
					
					They made the younger generation of Japan deformed ideologically and morally through their politics and education, oblivious of the lesson taught by history. In case they launch a war against the DPRK, it will result in harassing peace in Korea and the rest of Asia and turning the region into a huge battle field.
					
					That is why Japan's present views on politics, history and education are termed the most reactionary, impudent and brigandish ones in the post war period.
					
					History education in Japan should be oriented toward apologizing and repenting of wartime crimes.
					
					Japan has no future as it forces its younger generation to repeat its past defeat, far from drawing lesson from it.
					
					Such behavior of Japan will only precipitate the miserable end of its state and archipelago.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Behave Itself
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Behave Itself
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The U.S. recently shipped a Striker armored car unit into south Korea, kicking off an odd military racket of opening it to media.
					Rodong Sinmun Friday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					This is aimed to give a shot in the arm of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in the grip of a serious political crisis.
					
					The U.S. would be well advised to get rid of reckless war vertigo and behave itself, the commentary warns, and goes on:
					
					It seeks to boost the morale of the group through various demonstrations of military muscle and joint military exercises. This is nothing but an act of egging it to provoke the DPRK as it pleases, counting on the U.S. backing.
					
					These moves are very dangerous acts of pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme phase of confrontation and war.
					
					The situation on the peninsula is getting strained as the days go by due to the U.S. provocative acts in the wake of the DPRK's announcement of its plan for scientific and technological satellite launch. The U.S. is kicking up a row, terming the DPRK's projected satellite launch as a missile launch and a "violation." In collusion with south Korea and Japan and other allies, the U.S. is making much fuss, letting spy planes fly and dispatching Aegis warships and making preparations for intercepting the rocket.
					
					The situation goes to prove that the U.S. is set to deliberately strain the situation and instigate the south Korean puppet forces to ignite another Korean war.
					
					The U.S. warlike forces are now busy creating fear of crisis and horror among people, asserting that the debris of the rocket used by the DPRK for launching a satellite may fall over one of Southeast Asian countries and island countries in the Pacific. This is part of the preparations for provoking a war against the DPRK and a farce to whip up war atmosphere.
					
					However, everything will never happen as intended by the U.S. 
					
					A new war on the Korean Peninsula will do the U.S. nothing good.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper on DPRK's Planned Satellite Launch
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper on DPRK's Planned Satellite Launch
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Internet paper Thongil News carried an article titled "Let the south's satellite be launched by the north's carrier rocket Unha" on April 2. The north will launch a working satellite in the middle of April, the article said, and went on:
					When the north announced its plan to launch Kwangmyongsong-3, an earth observation satellite, by carrier rocket Unha-3, south Korea, the U.S. and Japan opposed to it.
					
					They say the north seeks to carry out a long-range missile test.
					
					What they fear is that if satellite is launched successfully and nuclear warhead is put on it, it can hit the U.S. mainland.
					
					But the north says that the satellite will help estimate the distribution of forest resources, natural disaster and grain harvest and that it is also necessary for weather forecast and prospecting of natural resources.
					
					Question of whether it would be a "satellite or missile" is by no means a new topic. When the north launched satellites in 1998 and 2009, the U.S. imposed sanctions on the north through the UNSC in the wake of similar controversy.
					
					The north refuted it, saying "if it can not launch a satellite because it requires ballistic missile technology such as long-range missile, it would mean that it will forever be left with no right to launch satellite".
					
					In fact, satellites were launched from many countries including Japan and Iran and lots of regions unhindered.
					
					The north will launch a satellite under the outer space treaty which stipulates that it is the right of all the countries to develop and use space for peaceful purposes.
					
					In the meantime Lee Myung Bak shared the U.S. view that the north should drop the launch plan as it is a provocation violating the UNSC resolution and the U.S.-DPRK agreement.
					
					He even blustered that President Obama and he would adopt durable coordinated defense posture between south Korea and the U.S. and resolutely cope with any threat and provocation from the north.
					
					It seems that south Korea feels secured backed by the U.S. But it sounds pitiful when it will have to be accepted as its response to the north.
					
					It's sure that the U.S. seeks its own national interests. But doubtful is what south Korea aims to gain by repeating the words of its alliance with the U.S.
					
					As for the February 29 agreement, the north said that "it clarified in the three rounds of previous DPRK-U.S. high-ranking talks that satellite launch should never be included in the long-range missile launch". Mentioned in the agreement was the long-range missile, not satellite.
					
					The north sent data about the place of the launch, orbit and multistage rocket separation to the International Civil Aviation Organization, the International Maritime Organization, the International Telecommunication Union and other organizations consistent with international regulations and procedures.
					
					It also invited foreign experienced experts on space science and technology and journalists to visit the Sohae Satellite Launching Station, the General Satellite Control and Command Centre and other places to observe its launch. 
					
					According to the February 29 agreement, the north also invited the delegation of the International Atomic Energy Agency for the discussion of the procedures for the confirmation of the moratorium on uranium enrichment.
					
					The north seems to have developed the technologies capable of putting into orbit working satellite, not only experimental satellites.
					
					But the south has not yet developed missiles with more than 300 km at range, due to the U.S. restrictions. So the south launched satellites atop Russian missiles more than once only to fail.
					
					The south now plans to lobby Japan, which invaded Korea in the past, to help it launch a satellite.
					
					The south has treated Japan with generosity, showing signs of forgiveness, reconciliation and cooperation and letting Japanese Self-Defence Forces take part in south Korea-U.S. joint military drills.  Although the south suffered from decades of the Japanese imperialists' occupation, it formed a friendly relationship with Japan two decades after Korea's liberation.
					
					At this moment, the north is busy making preparations for the satellite launch while the south is facing the political situation ahead of the election of "National Assembly".
					
					The south Koreans should approach the election with correct understanding of history and cool understanding of the times and with the awareness that alliance is temporary while the nation is eternal.
					
					The first objective of the divided nation is the country's reunification. The south and the north should hold the initiative in reaching the south-north agreement on establishing federation at an early date.
					
					This task is assigned to us. Who would dare try to control our destiny while we insist we can do it ourselves? We have experience of having done such a thing. That was the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration in 2000.
					
					One rare idea comes up to my head over the controversy of satellite or missile. That is "the south and the north should meet and proclaim the Federal Republic of Corea and put the south artificial satellite into orbit by the north's carrier rocket Unha".
					
					Then no country in the world will find fault with it, questioning whether it is a satellite or missile.
					
					This is not a dream. This dream can and must come true.

articles.title: Probe into Illegal Investigation into Civilians Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Illegal Investigation into Civilians Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- More than 270 civic and social organizations of south Korea including the Citizen's Solidarity for Democratic Society held a press conference in Seoul on April 3 at which they issued a declaration on the situation calling for probe into the truth about the illegal investigation into civilians and punishment of its prime mover. 
					The declaration urged Lee Myung Bak to probe the truth about the illegal investigation and make an apology to the people.
					
					This case is not a simple abuse of power but a hideous case in which such officials as those of Chongwadae, the office of the "Prime Minister", prosecution and lawmakers from the ruling party are all involved in a bid to conduct an indiscriminate investigation into people from all walks of life and destroy its evidence, it said.
					
					Recalling that the Lee "government" is resorting to mean acts to gloss over the above-said case, the declaration stressed the people would not pardon it.
					
					On the same day, civic and social organizations decided to launch emergency actions against illegal investigation and declared they would intensify actions through candlelight meetings denouncing the authorities' criminal moves.

articles.title: Voice of Russia Snubs Reaction of U.S., Japan and S. Korea to DPRK's Projected Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Voice of Russia Snubs Reaction of U.S., Japan and S. Korea to DPRK's Projected Satellite Launch
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Voice of Russia issued an article disclosing the desperate efforts of the U.S., Japan and south Korea to realize their sordid ambitions by taking the advantage of the DPRK's projected launch of a satellite for peaceful purposes.
					The U.S. was the first to promptly react to the DPRK's plan for satellite launch, the article said, and went on:
					
					Clear is that the U.S. spy satellites failed to capture DPRK's preparations for the satellite launch. 
					
					So, Washington was shocked late last year when it heard the news that the DPRK is to launch a satellite shortly.
					
					The U.S. came back to its senses a few months later and strongly urged the DPRK to cancel the launch, describing it as a ballistic missile launch.
					
					This, however, is nothing but an attempt to save its face and wrest the initiative.
					
					The DPRK's plan for satellite launch will benefit the Obama administration because it will help Obama show Americans once again his determination to fight "evil" before the presidential election.
					
					The U.S. Department of Defense will also benefit from it. The story about "threat" from the DPRK would make U.S. Congress provide the U.S. forces with funds needed for their expansion in the Asia-Pacific region despite serious shortage of budget. 
					
					The U.S. found fault with Russia and China to conceal its belligerence. If Japan's media reports are correct, the U.S. groundlessly urged the DPRK to entrust the launch of its satellite to Russia or China. But the DPRK turned down the U.S. request.
					
					It seems that Japan favors the DPRK's planned satellite launch. Japan can have a pretext for mobilizing Aegis warships and deploying "Patriot" interceptor missiles ready for action under the pretext of "intercepting" the DPRK missile.
					
					A destroyer of Japan already left for the East Sea of China.
					
					Alexei Arbatov, analyst of the Institute of the World Economy and International Relations of the Russian Academy of Sciences, said that Japan tries to "intercept" the DPRK missile but it is not its original intention.
					
					"To intercept such a rocket which is neither a military missile nor a missile targeted against the U.S. and Japan and whose mission is to put satellite into orbit would mean a direct act of war. In other words, this is an act of war that can trigger more serious crisis and armed conflict on the Korean Peninsula," he added.
					
					The south Korean military bases were put on an emergency alert, to say nothing of the U.S. military bases there.
					
					They are frightening the people, saying that the missile debris may fall on their heads. But such hysteria will never help the authorities win public favor.
					
					And the DPRK remains unchanged in its stand to launch the satellite.
					
					The Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea is to take place in Pyongyang on April 11 amid worldwide attention following the announcement of its plan for satellite launch.
					
					The conference would put up "Kwangmyongsong" (meaning lodestar) just as carrier rocket does.

articles.title: DPRK's Projected Satellite Launch Supported by Figures of Int'l Organization, France, Indonesia
articles.content:
DPRK's Projected Satellite Launch Supported by Figures of Int'l Organization, France, Indonesia
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Figures of an international organization, France and Indonesia released statements between March 29 and 31 in support of the DPRK's plan for launching working satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					The director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea said that the DPRK's projected satellite launch is an exercise of the independent and legitimate right pursuant to international law on the peaceful use of space. He went on:
					
					The U.S. claim that the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes is a challenge to world peace is aimed to wantonly violate the September 19 joint statement and the spirit of respect for sovereignty and equality of the DPRK-U.S. agreement based on it.
					
					I urge the U.S. to discard the biased stand which stemmed from inveterate enmity and hostile policy toward the DPRK and stop at once all acts of opposing the DPRK's satellite launch for the peaceful use of space.
					
					The chairman of the Anti－Imperialist Front of France said that it is unacceptable and clear double standards for the U.S. and other Western countries to term the DPRK's satellite launch a missile launch and "a violation of UNSC resolution." 
					
					The manager of Milenia Armada Express Company of Indonesia said that Kwangmyogsong-3, an earth observation satellite, will contribute to the peaceful use of space and scientific and technological development of mankind.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in China
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in China
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting for remembering President Kim Il Sung was held in China on April 3.
					Present there were Li Zade, Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter in China, and his family, families of Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyrs and other Chinese people related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, the DPRK ambassador to China and staff members of his embassy.
					
					The participants laid floral baskets before portraits of the President and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Zhang Jinlu, daughter of Zhang Weihua, Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, said that the President's was the brilliant life of a great man, adding he was not only the distinguished leader of the Korean people but the pioneer of the Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, noted that it is her duty to contribute to boosting the Sino-DPRK friendship as one who was honored to be received by the three commanders of Mt. Paektu of the DPRK.
					
					Daughters of Shang Yue and Feng Zhongyun, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, recalled with deep emotion the deep loving care shown by the President for them. 
					
					They vowed to value the friendship between the two countries and make every possible effort to glorify it generation after generation.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Laos
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Laos

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Nepal
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Nepal
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the Nepali National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of the Birth of President Kim Il Sung took place at the building of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) on April 1.

articles.title: Peruvian Political Figure Praises Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Peruvian Political Figure Praises Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, praised President Kim Il Sung as a great statesman in the 20th century.

					The Workers' Party of Korea turned into an ever-victorious party and the DPRK into an invincible power under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung, a great statesman, thinker and theoretician in the 20th century and father of socialist Korea.
					
					The anti-DPRK forces headed by the U.S. imperialists are working hard to stifle socialism in the DPRK.
					
					Even at this hour exercises for a nuclear war of aggression are being staged across south Korea.
					
					The U.S. chief executive inspected the area of the south side along the Military Demarcation Line, a symbol of the division of the Korean Peninsula, some time ago to fan up war hysteria. 
					
					The People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru strongly denounces this.
					
					The DPRK continues making dynamic progress to frustrate the moves of Yankee imperialism and its stooges against the DPRK and win a victory of socialism.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated Abroad
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Meetings, photo exhibitions and film shows took place in Myanmar, Mexico and Poland on March 30 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun.
					Displayed at the venues were works of the President and leader Kim Jong Il and photos of their undying feats as well as books and photos of the achievements of the Korean people in building a thriving socialist nation.

					The general director of the Ministry of Sports of Myanmar said that to significantly commemorate the centenary of the birth of the President is the common desire of the world progressive people including the people of Myanmar. He praised the great life and feats of the President.

					The chairman of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association noted that the future of the DPRK is rosy as long as the feats of the great leaders are being brilliantly inherited and there are the powerful defence capabilities.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" was published in pamphlet by the Alina-ve Publishing House in Vladivostok, Russia on the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Global Trend for Space Development
articles.content:
Global Trend for Space Development
Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Several countries have become more brisk in their moves to develop and use the outer space since the outset of 2012.
					On Feb. 6, China opened to public a video footage of the moon that has 7m-resolving capability, taken by the lunar satellite "Change 2".
					
					The State Administration of Science and Technology for National Defence of China said no country has ever made public a video footage of the moon that has 7m-resolving capability and contains its whole surface.
					
					With a plan to launch 21 rockets with 30 satellites atop this year, China has already succeeded in launching four of them.
					
					China set higher goals such as launching and operating its own space station and blasting off a satellite to prospect Mars till 2020 and has made positive efforts to put them into practice.
					
					Russia announced an 18-year plan for developing space at the beginning of this year and has stepped up the work for development and use of the space.
					
					It envisages a manned flight to the moon and landing on it as well as a long-term research.
					
					It also contemplates operating a research center on Mars and manufacturing a transport spaceship that can be used several times to increase the efficiency of the international space station.
					
					Russia has pressed ahead with the work to increase its satellites on the orbit and decrease the danger of meteorites and comet likely to affect the earth.
					
					Iran succeeded in putting satellite Navid into its planned orbit in February this year in the wake of the successful launch of its first satellite in June of 2011. It is said that the weight of Navid is over treble that of the first one.
					
					Vietnam, Venezuela, India, Nigeria, Argentina, Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Mexico, the Netherlands, Turkey, Poland and many other countries have shaped aggressive space policies and development plans to suit their actual conditions and foundations and set about conquering space. Cooperation and assistance are being boosted among them.
					
					Some countries in the world are taking bold approaches towards establishing and reinforcing their own global position systems, independent on the U.S. GPS.
					
					China that planned to complete the global position system "Beidou" till 2020 is set to operate the system late this year.
					
					Russia is also mulling reinforcing its own global position system "Glonas". 
					
					It successfully blasted off space vehicles needed to establish the system late last year, making it possible to send position signals nonstop throughout the globe. 
					
					Russia aims at making "Glonas" superior to GPS. It is assertion of Russia that "Glonas" should not be inferior to GPS in all indexes but should be better than the latter.
					
					The European Union invested a huge amount of fund in research and development of satellite flight in an effort to build infrastructure for the Galileo global position system and improve the service for flight.
					
					It is said that the system is likely to go fully operational by 2018 and compete with the GPS and "Glonas".
					
					The facts go to prove that the global space science and technology have made rapid progress and it has become a trend in the 21st century to develop the outer space, common wealth of mankind, for peaceful purposes. 
					
					The international community's approach towards peaceful development and use of the space will get more brisk and multi-polar.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un inspecciona la unidad 155 de fuerzas navales del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un inspecciona la unidad 155 de fuerzas navales del EPC
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea y Maximo Dirigente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el pueblo, inspecciono la unidad 155 de las fuerzas navales del EPC condecorada con el titulo de Septimo Regimiento de O Jung Hup.
					Ante todo, el recorrio el monumento a la visita de orientacion del Presidente Kim Il Sung y los buques de guerra visitados por los generales del monte Paektu.
					
					Recordo con emocion aquel dia inolvidable e historico en que habia visitado la unidad junto con el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, diciendo que en ella estan registradas muchas huellas de direccion del Presidente y el Dirigente.
					
					Gracias a la sabia direccion y minuciosa atencion de ellos que hicieron ingentes esfuerzos mentales y fisicos por la fundacion y el fortalecimiento de las fuerzas navales, Corea pudo tener hoy su invencible flota, apunto y agrego que sus hazanas inmortales brillaran eternamente en los anales de la patria.
					
					Volvio a apreciar los orgullosos meritos militares de la unidad que durante la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria (1950-1953), logro el exito sin precedentes en la historia de batallas navales del mundo al hundir el crucero pesado norteamericano "Baltimore" con solo 4 torpederos en la batalla naval de Jumunjin y en el tiempo de paz, sorprendio al mundo al atrapar el barco espia armado de EE.UU. "Pueblo" que invadio las aguas jurisdiccionales de Corea.
					
					Subrayo que al recibir el testigo de los precursores de la revolucion, los marineros                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     de la unidad deben hundir implacablemente a los enemigos si estos se atreven a invadir el mar territorial del pais y continuar de generacion en generacion la tradicion de esta unidad fuerte e invencible.
					
					El Comandante Supremo recorrio la lancha patrullera 1003 anclada en amarradero.
					
					Paso revista a varios puntos de ese buque donde estuvieron los 3 Generales del monte Paektu y aprecio a los marineros que lo conservan bien in statu quo.
					
					Dijo que este buque de significado historico, visitado 4 veces por el Presidente, 3 veces por el Dirigente y una vez por la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk, es la nave capitana de las fuerzas navales del EPC.
					
					Tras averiguar detalladamente la mision de combate, el estado de entrenamiento de la unidad, etc. inspecciono las flotillas 1, 4, 5 y 83 de la unidad.
					
					El Comandante Supremo dirigio el ejercicio de manejo de canones y el tactico del torpedero 1213 de la flotilla 1.
					
					Satisfecho de que los marineros realizaran intensamente el ejercicio de combate y cumplieran responsablemente la mision de guardia vigilando agudamente las maniobras agresivas de los enemigos, presento las tareas para la preparacion de combate y el aumento de combatividad.
					
					Presto profunda atencion a las condiciones de vida de los marineros recorriendo los cuarteles, salas de educacion y comedores de las flotillas.
					
					Dio como recuerdo a las flotillas 1, 4, 5 y 83 los gemelos y fusiles automaticos y se retrato con los uniformados de ellas.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion los generales de ejercito del EPC, Kim Won Hong y Hyon Chol Hae, y los tenientes generales del EPC, Ri Tu Song y Ri Jong Mu.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe presente de delegacion china

articles.title: ACR de RPDC censura a Lee Myung Bak por impedir labor humanitaria
articles.content:
ACR de RPDC censura a Lee Myung Bak por impedir labor humanitaria
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ACNC) -- El Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja (ACR) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 6 una informacion detallada condenando a la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak que durante su mandato violo el espiritu de la Cruz Roja y llevo al fracaso la labor humanitaria entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					Segun el documento, el traidor Lee revolco la labor humanitaria de la Cruz Roja intercoreana, que estaba en activacion con motivo del 15 de junio de 2000, y la  bloqueo.
					
					Al hacer que el Ministerio titere de Reunificacion interviniera en esa labor, convirtio en letra muerta el papel de la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea y designo como ministro de Reunificacion y director general de esta sociedad a los perniciosos maniacos de confrontacion para convertirla en servidora de las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					En marzo de 2010 invento el caso de hundimiento de la corbeta surcoreana "Cheonan" para exacerbar la situacion y corto totalmente la cooperacion humanitaria N-S en virtud de la "medida del 24 de mayo".
					
					Nego las historicas declaraciones intercoreanas y los consensos segun estas, de modo que las labores de cooperacion humanitaria, que se impulsaban activamente en el periodo pasado, quedaron paralizadas.
					
					Ante todo, quedo suspendida la labor de encuentros de familiares y parientes separados, que se presenta como una labor mas urgente en la cooperacion humanitaria N-S.
					
					Puso estupidamente punto final al encuentro de familiares y parientes que se realizaba en varias veces en cada ano en el monte Kumgang tras el 15 de junio de 2000.
					
					Ya desaparecio totalmente el encuentro por imagenes y el intercambio de cartas de imagen entre el Norte y el Sur.
					
					Solo durante un ano pasado en el Sur de Corea, mas de 4 mil aspirantes al encuentro fallecieron denunciando a la banda de Lee sin satisfacer sus deseos de reunirse con los familiares y parientes del Norte. 
					
					La banda titere creo otros nuevos familiares y parientes separados mediante la seduccion y secuestro a los habitantes norcoreanos y el complot intrigante anti-RPDC. 
					
					Interrumpio la labor de cooperacion humanitaria pretextando el uso particular para los asuntos militares y la transparencia, y mediante la enmienda total de la "ley de intercambio y cooperacion Sur-Norte" fortalecio el control legal para que no se entregue al Norte ni un gramo de materiales sin permiso del Ministerio titere de Reunificacion.
					
					Estorbo torpe y brutalmente la labor de cooperacion humanitaria relacionada con las calamidades naturales.
					
					Tomo como su politica importante armar alborotos con el supuesto tema de DDHH de la RPDC diciendo que "hablaria del derecho humano del Norte si es necesario".
					
					Designo en el cargo de la cabecilla del Comite de Derechos Humanos del Sur de Corea un conservador ultraderechista que no sabe la concepcion elemental sobre DDHH y convirtio este organo en un aparato venal que se hace cargo de la locura intrigante de DDHH anti-RPDC, insiste la nota. 
					
					A pesar de la advertencia repetida de la RPDC, incito a los tipejos y los elementos histericos anti-RPDC a hacer volar en globos las volantes y otras cosas  triviales insultantes a esta.
					
					Y hasta en la escena internacional calumnio la dignidad y el regimen de la RPDC y recurrio con frenesi a las intrigas de DDHH anti-RPDC.
					
					El tremendo crimen perpetrado por la banda de Lee  en el periodo del gran duelo nacional de diciembre del ano pasado y el reciente acto provocativo que ofendio la maxima dignidad de la RPDC son el climax de las maniobras conflictivas anti-RPDC de caracter antihumanitario y antietico y son los actos barbaros que puede perpetrar solo la horda de Lee.
					
					Es inimaginable que la RPDC discuta con estos tipejos sobre el tema humanitario.

articles.title: CRN denuncia postura conflictiva de Park Geun-hye
articles.content:
CRN denuncia postura conflictiva de Park Geun-hye
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional (CRN) hizo publica el dia 6 una declaracion para condenar a Park Geun-hye del "Partido Saenuri" del Sur de Corea que expone cada vez mas abiertamente su atributo conflictivo y anti-reunificacion a medida que se acercan las elecciones de "parlamentarios" en el Sur de Corea.
					Al describir el lanzamiento de satelite artificial de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea "Kwangmyongsong-3" como prueba de misil de largo alcance, ella lo cuestiona tanto como "desafio a la paz mundial" abogando por "ejercer presion internacional" a la RPDC, comienza el texto de la nota y prosigue:
					
					Por otra parte, se atrevio a difamar a la RPDC y suplico a un pais tercero que "suspenda la devolucion al Norte" de los que salieron ilegalmente.
					
					Ademas, protegiendo a unas escorias humanas, trata postularlas al circulo politico del Sur de Corea.
					
					Lanza de otro lado una sucia ofensiva de color diciendo asi: "Nadie sabe lo que pasaria si se eligen como ´parlamentarios´ los que niegan el hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" por el Norte. No se debe entregar el "poder" a los opositores que rechazan el ´Tratado de Libre Comercio´ Sur de Corea-Estados Unidos y la construccion de la base naval en la isla Jeju. Es preciso impedir a toda costa la toma del poder de los ´izquierdistas seguidores al Norte´".
					
					Esta campana de enfrentamiento fratricida que libra Park en contubernio con el traidor Lee Myung Bak, revela que el "cambio" y la "reforma", de que habla tanto ella, son embustes para enganar a la opinion publica y ella es tan conflictiva con la connacional RPDC como el segundo.
					
					Ella es prostituta politica que cada vez que le convenia o no, solia abrazarse o separarse del "poder" y partido gobernante conservadores.
					
					La realidad demuestra claramente que ella es estafadora politica y antojada del poder que vende e invierte lo todo para satisfacer sus ambiciones politicas.
					
					Es evidente que si esa vibora toma el poder, renacera en el Sur de Corea el fantasma del dictador de "renovacion" y se llevaran a la peor fase las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					Los habitantes surcoreanos de diferentes sectores deben castigar sin falta a la banda de traidores conservadores en las inminentes elecciones generales sin dejarse enganar por Park y sus compinches.

articles.title: ACNC vuelve a criticar la ambicion de Japon sobre el islote Tok
articles.content:
ACNC vuelve a criticar la ambicion de Japon sobre el islote Tok
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ACNC) -- Prosigue de generacion en generacion la ambicion de los reaccionarios japoneses de usurpar el islote Tok. 
					Segun la indicacion del gobierno japones, crecieron a 21 los tipos de manuales de ciencias sociales de las escuelas superiores como historia y geografia que describen el islote coreano Tok como "territorio japones". Ese numero representa mas de la mitad de 39 tipos en total de esos libros.
					
					Cuando se formularon las protestas al respecto, el director del secretariado del gabinete dijo que "no se puede aceptarlas y seguiria abordando ese tema desde la posicion invariable de Japon". 
					
					La "soberania" de Japon sobre el islote Tok, que antes insistian unos elementos ultraderechistas, se hace ahora una politica sobre la educacion bajo el patrocinio del gobierno. 
					
					Esa opinion de gangster y la educacion del particular toman por premisa la guerra de nueva agresion a Corea, lo cual pone cautelosos e indignados a todos los coreanos. 
					
					Tanto en el pasado como en el presente, el islote Tok es una parte del sagrado territorio coreano y no puede existir ahi ningun "litigio". 
					
					Sin embargo, los reaccionarios japoneses educan a las nuevas generaciones con la idea de que el islote Tok esta en litigio territorial, para estimularlas a lanzar la guerra de nueva agresion a Corea orientada a arrebatar el Tok. 
					
					De suceder eso, sera perturbada la paz en Corea y Asia y esta region se convertira en un gran escenario de guerra. 
					
					Por esta razon, la concepcion de politica, la de historia y la de educacion de Japon son reconocidas como las mas reaccionarias, descaradas y gangsteriles. 
					
					La educacion en la historia en Japon debe ser orientada a disculparse y arrepentirse de los crimenes de guerra. 
					
					No hay futuro para Japon que obliga a las generaciones venideras a repetir la historia de su gran derrota en la Segunda Guerra Mundial. 
					
					Lo que espera a ese pais es la destruccion final del archipielago japones.

articles.title: Inaugurada la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon
articles.content:
Inaugurada la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon
Pyongyang, 6 de abril (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon que permitira resolver con mas satisfaccion el problema de electricidad en la ciudad de Pyongyang, proteger de las inundaciones las tierras cultivables y poblados en la cuenca del rio Chongchon y proveer en lo suficiente de las aguas de uso industrial a las fabricas y empresas de las zonas de Huichon y Namhung.
					Los constructores terminaron en 3 anos esa obra, de la cual se decia que iba a tardar mas de 10 anos.
					
					Tuvieron lugar el dia 5 por separado los actos inaugurales de la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon no.1 y la no. 2.
					
					Participaron en las ocasiones Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Kim Yong Chun, Choe Thae Bok, Thae Jong Su y otros cuadros.
					
					Se dio lectura al mensaje de felicitacion que envian a nombre comun el Comite Central y la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea a los constructores militares, miembros de brigadas de trabajo, funcionarios y voluntarios quienes realizaron brillantes proezas laborales en la construccion de la central.
					
					El mensaje senala que los constructores de la central, quienes materializaron a toda costa los legados del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y demostraron a todo el mundo que Corea cumple lo que decide, son descendientes verdaderos del Presidente, soldados y discipulos del Dirigente, heroes y patriotas de la epoca que debe elogiar todo el pais.
					
					Subraya que el PTC no olvidara nunca las proezas heroicas de los constructores de la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon que levantaron esta gran creacion monumental por la prosperidad de la patria y la felicidad del pueblo.
					
					Precisa que al construir magnificamente en un corto tiempo en la tierra de Huichon una gran base de produccion energetica, ellos hicieron gran aporte a resolver el problema de electricidad del pais e infundieron fe en la victoria y esperanza a todos los habitantes.
					
					El discurso inaugural de ambos actos estuvo a cargo de Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Choe destaco que la central de Huichon es una orgullosa creacion monumental de la epoca del Songun construida bajo la sabia guia del Dirigente    Kim Jong Il quien deseaba construir un Estado prospero socialista en territorio patrio.
					
					Se refirio a los exitos logrados en la obra y destaco que esos son frutos de la sabia direccion y minuciosa atencion del Dirigente y el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un quienes presentaron el gran proyecto de la construccion de la Central y orientaron energicamente la lucha por ponerlo en practica.
					
					Seguidamente, hubo intervenciones.
					
					Los participantes recorrieron la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon no. 1 y la no. 2.
